results.title: Elephant boy
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, Alexander Korda, Robert Joseph Flaherty and Zoltan Korda
results.brief_description: Based on Kipling”s “Toomai of the Elephants”, with Sabu as little Toomai, son of the Mahout, and Kala Nag, the elephant. Tells the story of a government expedition in search of wild elephants in the state of Mysore. Toomai’s adventures with Kala Nag and the herd of wild elephants finally leads him to be accorded with the same title of his famous grandfather “Toomai of the Elephants”. This film was beset with difficulties from the start. After years of attempting to obtain sufficient finance to film Kipling’s original story, Flaherty found support from Alexander Korda in 1935 and the Flahertys journeyed to India to adopt (from them) a new method of film making - the original practice adopted by Flaherty of “letting the story flow” and absorbing the way of life of native people and their surroundings was not entirely carried out in the case of “Elephant boy”. Whilst much of the film was shot in studios in England, the film is distinguished by beautiful photography and many fine sequences breathing the very atmosphere of India, captured by Flaherty on location

results.title: Elephant (2004) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Blue Relief, Fearmakers Studios, Home Box Office, Dany Wolf and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: This austere work from Gus Van Sant, based on the Columbine High School tragedy, presents two days in the life of the young killers and their victims. Following on from the style set in “Gerry” (2002) Van Sant allows long takes and unobtrusive camera work to watch the students in their milieu. Van Sant displays ordinary teenagers beset by loneliness, pettiness, insecurities and rivalry. Cast includes: Alex Frost, Eric Deulen, John Robinson, Elias McConnell and Jordan Taylor. Also available on VHS [319040].

results.title: Elena and her men = Elena et les hommes [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Franco London Film (Paris), Les Films Gibe, Electra Compagnia Cinematografica and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Slightly naughty, light-hearted and often farcical, this French/Italian romantic comedy tells the tale of a poverty-stricken young Polish princess (Ingrid Bergman) living with her Aunt in turn-of-the-century Paris during a time of political unrest and on the eve of WWI. The whimsical and arresting Princess Elena suddenly finds herself the centre of attention when she joins the street festivities on Bastille Day, firstly by meeting and falling in love with a handsome young count named Henri (Mel Ferrer) and then being introduced to Henri’s friend, General Rollan (Jean Marais) who is immediately entranced by Elena’s sensuous beauty. However, Henri’s priorities, although quite smitten with Elena, are political and lie in his quest to persuade General Rollan to seize power. For this he decides to enlist Elena and her charms. Meanwhile, Elena has already promised herself in marriage to a wealthy, boorish, shoe-maker. What is she to do and who shall she choose? Bergman is simply gorgeous in her role as the Princess Elena, with a smile that would melt even the coldest heart. An amusing and entertaining film not to be taken too seriously. Cast also includes Jean Richard, Juliet Greco, Pierre Bertin, Magali Noel, Elina Labourdette. Cinematography by Claude Renoir. In French with English subtitles. NB: Quality of color and editing inconsistent. Originally 98 minutes in length, the film was inexpertly cut to 86 minutes for its American showings and then restored to its full 98 minutes in 1986.

results.title: Election
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, MTV Films, Bona Fide Productions, Albert Berger, Ron Yerxa, David Gale, Keith Samples and Alexander Payne
results.brief_description: Matthew Broderick plays Jim McAllister, a popular and well respected teacher at George Washington Carver High School. Reese Witherspoon is Tracy Flick, A-Grade student and No. 1 candidate for the student body president. Tracy is confident that her campaign for presidency is going smoothly until Mr McAllister decides to disrupt proceedings and introduce opposition to her as yet unchallenged ride to the top. More than a teenage flick, director Alexander Payne has satirized the popular genre to investigate notions of political and moral corruption. In a clever piece of casting, Matthew Broderick exchanges his Ferris Bueller persona for the devoted and concerned teacher who is slightly burned out from years of teaching. Add to this the disillusionment of a dull marriage and the shameful dismissal of McAllister’s best friend and colleague, and the esteemed civic teacher’s sense of democracy is put to the test. Brilliant performances, subtle humour and an excellent screenplay (an Oscar nomination for Payne and co-writer Jim Taylor). Surprisingly, this film was a box office sleeper. Based on the novel by Tom Perrotta.

results.title: Eight millimeter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Joel Schumacher, Judy Hofflund and Gavin Polone
results.brief_description: A widow settling her husband’s estate, finds an 8mm film in his safe. The film on the reel is a “snuff” film, and shows a young girl being tortured and killed. Upset by the film, she hires private detective Tom Welles (Nicolas Cage) to find the girl on the film and determine if the film is real. When Tom learns the girl on the film is a runaway, his investigation takes him to Hollywood, where with the help of Max (Joaquin Phoenix), a clerk in an adult bookstore, he discovers the world of underground pornography, and his initial investigation becomes an obsession.

results.title: Ed TV
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Brian Grazer and Ron Howard
results.brief_description: Ed TV explores fame through the Big Brother phenomenon where ordinary people become famous just by allowing the nation to watch them 24/7. Ed (Matthew McConaughey) is chosen to be the star of the lastest real TV program. He agrees to allow cameras to film him 24 hours a day and broadcast this across the nation. After a shakey start the program takes off and Ed becomes the latest big thing. He initially enjoys his fame. But he starts to rethink his decision when the intrusive cameras potentially cause him to loose his new found love Shari(Jenna Elfman) and destory his family.

results.title: Eating Raoul
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, International Classis, Quartet, Quartet Films, Anne Kimmel and Paul Bartel
results.brief_description: Paul and Mary Bland, an endearingly middle-class couple, want to get out of their swinger-infested apartment building and open a nice little restaurant in the country. However, real estate is expensive and Paul has just lost his job. So, they take out a kinky ad and then knock off the rich swingers who answer it…Enter Raoul.

results.title: Eat drink, man woman
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Central Motion Pictures Corporation, Hsu Li Kong and Li-Kong Hsu
results.brief_description: Every Sunday retired master chef Chu (Sihung Lung) prepares a lavish Chinese banquet for his three daughters in their large old-fashioned house in Taipei. Jia-Jen (Kuei-Mei Yang) is a chemistry teacher with an angel’s voice. Jia-Chien (Chien-lien Wu) is an airline executive who must choose between her ties to her family and an opportunity to work in Europe. Finally, Jia-Ning, the youngest daughter has a crush on her best friends boyfriend. Over chef Chu’s sumptuous dishes the family slowly reveals its secrets. Taiwanese director Ang Lee creates a marvelous mix of mouth watering Chinese cuisine, the anxieties of family life and the search for love. With great performances from the whole cast. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Eat a bowl of tea
results.creator_credit: American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Columbia Pictures, Tom Sternberg and Wayne Wong
results.brief_description: Set between 1949-1951, Wayne Wong’s Capra-style comedy centers on an arranged marriage in New York’s Chinatown. The marriage is a romantic and emotional success until it comes under well-intended but intolerable pressures from the Chinese-American community. The film asks how a young couple can cope when there are few role models at hand and they are isolated from their parents. It also shows the drastic effect of the endless pressure from family and friends to bear children. The tone however remains light, and while broaching serious political and social issues, the film uses laughter rather than anger to highlight these. English and Cantonese dialogue with some English subtitles.

results.title: Easy rider [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Peter Fonda and Dennis Hopper
results.brief_description: This is a digitally remastered 30th anniversary collector’s edition of the modern classic tale of two carefree young men who take a leisurely motorcycle ride across the southern United States after concluding a drug deal to pay expenses. With an exceptional performance by Jack Nicholson as an alcoholic lawyer, the cast also includes Peter Fonda and Dennis Hopper.
